Description: AWARD PURPOSE: THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO SAVE WATER AND ELIMINATE THE RISK OF CANAL FAILURE BY DESIGNING A NEW WATER CONVEYANCE SYSTEM FOR THE KINGMAN LATERAL.    THIS WILL INCREASE WATER AVAILABILITY AND REDUCE RISK, POSED BY CANAL FAILURE, TO PEOPLE AND PROPERTY IN THE VICINITY OF THE LATERAL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL: DEVELOP A DESIGN THE CONVERSION OF THE KINGMAN LATERAL FROM AN OPEN CANAL CHANNEL TO A PIPES CANAL.  THIS DESIGN WILL ENCOMPASS THE REPLACEMENT OF 5,880 LINEAR FEET OF OPEN CANAL AND THE DESIGN OF THE INLET AND OUTLET STRUCTURES OF THE KINGMAN LATERAL.  EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OF THIS PROJECT IS A SHOVEL READY CONSTRUCTION PROJECT DESIGN THAT THE RECIPIENT CAN UTILIZE TO COMPLETE THE PIPING PROJECT SAVING WATER AND ELIMINATING THE RISK OF CANAL FAILURE.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE WATER USERS IN THE AREA AND LANDOWNERS SURROUNDING THE CANAL.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): NONE

THE SYSTEM OPTIMIZATION REVIEW (SOR) SHALL ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING PUBLIC PURPOSE SET FORTH IN THE ACT: (D) TO ENHANCE WATER MANAGEMENT: THE SOR PROJECT WILL UTILIZE THE LATEST SCIENTIFIC TECHNOLOGIES TO PERFORM HYDRAULIC MODELING, SYSTEM ANALYSIS, ASSET MANAGEMENT AND OPERATIONAL IMPROVEMENTS. THESE MEASURES WILL ALLOW THE RECIPIENT TO IDENTIFY A PLAN OF ACTION THAT CONTAINS RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTING SPECIFIC IMPROVEMENTS THAT WILL PROVIDE FOR CONSERVATION, UPDATE WATER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, AND BETTER UNDERSTAND CAPACITIES AND DEMANDS.ANALYZE FINANCIAL PARAMETERSANALYZE WATER RIGHTS PARAMETERSANALYZE ARCHITECTURAL PARAMETERSANALYZE FLOW CONTROL PARAMETERSANALYZE POWER GENERATION SYSTEM PARAMETERSANALYZE REGULATORY PARAMETERSSELECT IMPROVEMENT OPTIONS DEVELOP MODERNIZATION PLAN

WESTERN MUNICIPAL WATER DISTRICT (WESTERN) IS ONE OF THE LARGEST PUBLIC AGENCIES IN RIVERSIDE COUNTY, CALIFORNIA, PROVIDING WATER, WASTEWATER (SEWER), AND RECYCLED WATER SERVICES TO NEARLY 1 MILLION PEOPLE, BOTH WHOLESALE AND RETAIL CUSTOMERS, ACROSS 527-SQUARE MILES IN WESTERN RIVERSIDE COUNTY. WESTERN IS AN ACTIVE AND VISIBLE ADVOCATE AND RESOURCE FOR WISE WATER USE IN THE REGION. WESTERN HAS BEEN A LEADER IN WATER USE EFFICIENCY FOR MANY YEARS AND ACTIVELY COLLABORATES WITH LOCAL AND REGIONAL AGENCIES AND THE COMMUNITIES IT SERVES TO IMPLEMENT INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS AND DRIVE REDUCTIONS IN WATER USAGE.ALIGNING WITH WESTERNS GOAL TO DRIVE REDUCTIONS IN WATER USAGE, WESTERNS PILOT DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WILL HELP INFORM WATER LOSS AT PRESSURE REDUCING STATIONS AND HELP INFORM FUTURE DISTRICT METERED AREA (DMA) PROJECTS. THE PROJECT WILL INSTALL ELECTROMAGNETIC METERS AT THREE PRESSURE REDUCING STATIONS, COLLECT DATA AND ANALYZE THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN WATER LOSS AND PRESSURE CHANGES DURING HIGH AND LOW POINTS OF WATER FLOW, AND PRESENT THE FINDINGS TO VARIOUS WATER-RELATED STAKEHOLDERS IN THE REGION. THESE METERS TAKE FLOW READINGS EVERY MINUTE. THE FLOW READINGS ARE STORED AND MAY BE VIEWED USING THE SUPERVISORY CONTROL AND DATA ACQUISITION (SCADA) SYSTEM AND CAN BE EXPORTED TO A COMMA-SEPARATED VALUES FILE (CSV).

GROVERS HILL IRRIGATION DISTRICT (GHID) ORIGINALLY CONVEYED WATER TO ITS USERS VIA MORE THAN 16.5 MILES OF CONCRETE AND EARTHEN CANALS. THE 125 YEAR OLD CONCRETE AND EARTHEN CANAL CONVEYANCE SYSTEM IS IN THE PROCESS OF BEING UPGRADED TO A HIGH DENSITY POLYETHYLENE (HDPE) PIPELINE SYSTEM. THIS FOUR PHASE CONSTRUCTION PROJECT WAS PARTIALLY FUNDED BY A BUREAU OF RECLAMATION WATERSMART GRANT THAT GHID RECEIVED IN 2020. PHASE 1 WAS COMPLETED IN 2020 AND IMPLEMENTED 16,460 LINEAL FEET OF HDPE PIPELINE ON A PORTION OF THE LOWER CANAL. PHASE 2 WAS COMPLETED IN 2021 AND REPLACED THE MIDDLE CANAL IN ITS ENTIRETY WITH THE INSTALLATION OF APPROXIMATELY 20,799 LINEAL FEET OF HDPE PIPELINE. PHASE 3 AND PHASE 4 CONSTRUCTION IS CURRENTLY UNDERWAY, REPLACING 17,751 LINEAL FEET OF CONCRETE LINED CANAL WITH HDPE PIPELINE. CONSTRUCTION OF PHASE 4 IS ESTIMATED TO BE COMPLETE BEFORE APRIL 15TH, 2023. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE FOUR PHASE CONSTRUCTION PROJECT WAS TO REDUCE THE WATER LOST FROM EVAPORATION AND SEEPAGE BY REPLACING THE EXISTING EARTHEN CANALS WITH HDPE PIPE. THE EFFICIENCY OF THE SYSTEM HAS ALSO BEEN ENHANCED THROUGH THE INSTALLATION OF NECESSARY VALVES AND METERS TO TRACK WATER USAGE OF THE FARMERS AND GARDENERS THROUGH ALL FOUR PHASES OF THE PROJECT.CONDUCTING THIS SYSTEM OPERATION REVIEW (SOR) WILL ENABLE GHID TO ASSESS AND MEASURE WATER USAGE, WATER AVAILABILITY, SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS TO REDUCE SEDIMENT, IMPROVE DELIVERY THROUGH AUTOMATED SYSTEMS, AND IMPROVE WATER CONSERVATION EFFORTS.

THE COUNTY OF MAUI DEPARTMENT OF WATER SUPPLY (DWS) RELIES ON BOTH GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER FOR ITS SUPPLY SOURCE. THE WATER RESOURCES IN MANY LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE DWS SERVICE AREA ARE DESIGNATED AS WATER MANAGEMENT AREAS (WMA) UNDER THE STATE WATER CODE (HAWAII REVISED STATUTES CHAPTER 174-C) DUE TO THEIR THREATENED CONDITION, REQUIRING ADDITIONAL PROTECTION. SEE MAP OF PAGE 5. WATER CONSERVATION PLANS ARE REQUIRED TO DETAIL ACTIONS TO PROTECT WMA WATER RESOURCES.UNDER THIS AGREEMENT THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPLETE THE TASKS AND MILESTONES LISTED AS DESCRIBED BELOW. DWS WILL WORK WITH A SELECTED CONSULTANT TO DEVELOP THE WATER CONSERVATION PLANS. UPON ENTERING INTO A CONSULTANT CONTRACT, THE DWS PLANNER SHALL SERVE AS THE LEAD STAFF PERSON AND WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE CONSULTANT, THE MAUI COUNTY BOARD OF WATER SUPPLY, AND KEY DWS STAFF TO COMPLETE THE WATER CONSERVATION PLANS. DWS STAFF WILL BE PRIMARILY RESPONSIBLE FOR SOLICITING STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT THROUGHOUT THE PROCESS.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT (SATELLITE BASED LEAK DETECTION DEMONSTRATION PROJECT) HELPS RANCHO WATER FULFILL ITS WATER CONSERVATION COMMITMENTS, ASSISTS ALL SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA WATER AGENCIES IN FULFILLING THEIR OBLIGATION TO PROTECT STORAGE IN LAKES MEAD AND POWELL, AND HELPS RECLAMATION RESOLVE CONFLICTS OVER COLORADO RIVER WATER SUPPLIES.THE OBJECTIVES OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT ARE  1) TO LEVERAGE A NEW SATELLITE BASED TOOL IN ORDER TO LOCATE AND REPAIR RANCHO WATER DELIVERY SYSTEM LEAKS MORE EFFICIENTLY, AND 2) TO DEMONSTRATE USE OF THE TOOL TO WATER AGENCIES THROUGHOUT THE REGION. THESE OBJECTIVES ARE CONSISTENT WITH RECLAMATION S WATER CONSERVATION FIELD SERVICES PROGRAM GOAL OF INCREASING WATER RELIABILITY AND IMPROVING WATER MANAGEMENT THROUGH USE OF NEW TECHNOLOGIES. THROUGH USE OF THE SATELLITE BASED TOOL AND ITS DEMONSTRATION, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THE DISTRICT WILL REDUCE SYSTEM ITS SYSTEM WATER LOSS AND ENCOURAGE OTHERS TO DO THE SAME, THEREBY CONSERVING RECLAMATION WATER SUPPLIES AND HELPING TO RESOLVE CONFLICTS OVER COLORADO RIVER WATER.

THROUGH WATERSMART (SUSTAIN AND MANAGE AMERICA S RESOURCES FOR TOMORROW), RECLAMATION LEVERAGES FEDERAL AND NON FEDERAL FUNDING TO WORK COOPERATIVELY WITH STATES, TRIBES, AND LOCAL ENTITIES AS THEY PLAN FOR AND IMPLEMENT ACTIONS TO INCREASE WATER SUPPLY RELIABILITY THROUGH INVESTMENTS AND ATTENTION TO LOCAL WATER CONFLICTS. THIS GRANT SELECTED UNDER THE WATER CONSERVATION FIELD SERVICES PROGRAM PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROJECTS THAT WILL INCREASE WATER RELIABILITY AND IMPROVE WATER MANAGEMENT THROUGH THE PROMOTION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF WATER EFFICIENCY MEASURES.THE SILT WATER CONSERVANCY DISTRICT (SWCD) WAS ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF CONSERVING AND DEVELOPING LAND AND WATER RESOURCES FOR THE GREATEST BENEFICIAL USE OF WATER WITHIN THE SWCD BOUNDARIES OF GARFIELD COUNTY, COLORADO.SILT WATER CONSERVANCY DISTRICT (SWCD) SHALL USE THIS GRANT TO EVALUATE ALL THE WATER RIGHTS THAT IMPACT THE DRAINAGES SUPPLYING WATER TO SWCD FACILITIES. THESE WATER RIGHTS WILL INCLUDE THOSE OPERATED BY SWCD AS WELL AS THOSE NON SWCD RIGHTS THAT MUST BE SUPPLIED AND IMPACT THE OPERATIONS. PART OF THE PROCESS WILL INCLUDE CREATION OF A FLOW ANALYSIS REGIME FOR ALL THE WATER RIGHTS TO INCLUDE IN OVERALL SUPPLY DEMAND BALANCE EQUATIONS. ALSO, SWCD SHALL USE THIS GRANT TO ANALYZE AND CREATE EQUATIONS FOR THE FILL STORAGE AND SUPPLY CAPACITY AT ANY POINT IN TIME OF BOTH RESERVOIRS, HARVEY GAP AND  RIFLE GAP RESERVOIRS.

SUNNYDELL IRRIGATION DISTRICT HEAD OF CANAL REDESIGN  DESIGNING AND IMPROVED HEADGATE AND SPILLWAY STRUCTURE PROJECT ABSTRACTAWARD PURPOSE  WE ARE LOCATED IN THE COLUMBIA PLATEAU, OR THE COLUMBIA INTERMONTANE REGION, IN SOUTHEAST IDAHO  THE SUNNYDELL CANAL BEGAN OPERATING CIRCA 1910 TO PROVIDE WATER TO THE CITIZENS AND FARMS ALONG THE SOUTHWESTERN BORDER OF MADISON COUNTY IN IDAHO  THE HEAD OF THE CANAL FEEDS DIRECTLY FROM THE SNAKE RIVER BY THE HEISE AREA  THE CANAL ITSELF SHARES ONE BANK WITH THE SNAKE RIVER AND THE OTHER BANK IS THE BASE OF THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN FOOTHILLS  AS SHOWN IN THE IMAGES BELOW  THE CURRENT HEAD OF THE CANAL BEGINS JUST AFTER THE HEISE BRIDGE  FOR THE NEXT 2 MILES OR SO, THE CANAL RUNS BETWEEN THE SNAKE RIVER AND THE BASE OF THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN FOOTHILLS  THIS STRETCH IS PARTICULARLY DIFFICULT TO MAINTAIN BECAUSE OF ITS LOCATION NOT ONLY IS IT DIFFICULT TO PROPERLY MAINTAIN, BUT IT IS ALSO NOT VERY EFFICIENT  IT TAKES ABOUT 2 HOURS TO REGULATE THE WATER LEVELS FROM THE CURRENT HEAD TO THE FIRST DIVERSION POINT  A GREAT DEAL OF WATER IS LOST AS IT TRAVELS DOWN THESE 2 MILES OF CANAL SIMPLY BECAUSE THIS SECTION IS IN POOR REPAIR  AS WE HAVE WORKED WITH OUR BOR OFFICIALS, WE HAVE CONSIDERED SEVERAL WAYS TO IMPROVE OUR CANAL  INSTEAD OF DUMPING A BUNCH OF MONEY INTO THE EXISTING HEAD STRUCTURE AND BEGINNING SECTION OF THE CANAL, WE WOULD INSTEAD LIKE TO INSTALL A NEW HEADGATE AND SPILLWAY APPROXIMATELY 2 MILES DOWNSTREAM  THE PROPOSED LOCATION IS MUCH MORE ACCESSIBLE FOR CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE PURPOSES  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  THE RECIPIENT WILL HIRE AN ENGINEERING FIRM TO CONDUCT A SURVEY AND ENGINEERING DESIGNS OPTIONS TO IMPROVE, REMODEL, AND OR RELOCATION THE HEADGATE CONTROL STRUCTURE SPILLWAY FOR THE IRRIGATION DISTRICT  THE FIRST STEP ENGINEERING AND SURVEYING OF THE LOCATION, THEN DEVELOP A FINAL DESIGN PROPOSAL FOR THE BOARD TO APPROVE AND INSTALL IN A FUTURE DATE EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES THE NEW STRUCTURE WILL IMPROVE THE ABILITY TO CONTROL FLOW LEVELS AND CONSERVE WATER  THIS WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT STARTING UPON DATE OF AWARD, WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF JUNE 1, 2023 INTENDED BENEFICIARIES THIS PLANNING PROJECT SUPPORTS PLANNING FOR WATER MANAGERS TO PLAN, PRIORITIZE, AND DESIGN PROJECTS THAT CONSERVE AND USE WATER MORE EFFICIENTLY  MITIGATE CONFLICT RISK IN AREAS AT A HIGH RISK OF FUTURE WATER CONFLICT  AND ACCOMPLISH OTHER BENEFITS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO SUSTAINABILITY IN THE WESTERN UNITED STATES SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   N A

WATER MANAGEMENT, CONSERVATION, AND MODERNIZATION PLAN UPDATE PROJECT ABSTRACTAWARD PURPOSE NORTH SIDE CANAL COMPANY  NSCC  OWNS AND OPERATES A NETWORK OF 900 MILES OF CANALS USED TO CONVEY IRRIGATION WATER TO 160,000 ACRES OF FARMLAND BETWEEN HAZELTON AND KING HILL, IDAHO WITH THE MAIN OFFICE LOCATED IN JEROME  NSCC HAS EXISTING STORAGE WATER CONTRACTS WITH THE RECLAMATION IN JACKSON LAKE  WYOMING , PALISADES RESERVOIR  IDAHO , AND AMERICAN FALLS RESERVOIR  IDAHO , ALL LOCATED ON THE MAIN STEM OF THE SNAKE RIVER  THIS STORAGE WATER ALONG WITH NATURAL FLOW WATER RIGHTS ON THE SNAKE RIVER, ARE DIVERTED AT MILNER DAM, NEAR HAZELTON, IDAHO  THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF WATER RESOURCES THROUGH WATER DISTRICT  1 OVERSEES THE ADMINISTRATION AND ACCOUNTING OF NSCC S STORAGE AND NATURAL FLOW WATER RIGHTS THIS PLANNING PROJECT WILL UPDATE THE EXISTING WATER MANAGEMENT AND CONSERVATION PLAN THAT WAS COMPLETED BY CH2M HILL AND WILL BE USED TO GUIDE NSCC IN ITS FUTURE PLANNING AND PROJECT CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED NSCC WILL UPDATE THEIR 2003 WATER CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN  THE UPDATE WILL FOCUS ON DEFINING AREAS FOR CANAL IMPROVEMENTS, QUANTIFYING BENEFITS, AND PRIORITIZING PROJECTS BASED ON WATER SAVINGS, ENERGY SAVINGS, AND COSTS  THE NEW WATER CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN WILL PROVIDE DIRECTION TO NSCC STAKEHOLDERS TO SYSTEMATICALLY UPGRADE INFRASTRUCTURE WHERE IT IS MOST NEEDED AND IMPROVE WATER ADMINISTRATION AND CONTROL EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES THE UPDATED WATER MANAGEMENT AND CONSERVATION PLAN WILL PROVIDE NSCC WITH A ROADMAP OF PROJECTS THAT WILL ENABLE GREATER CONSERVATION OF WATER, DEFINE OPPORTUNITIES TO DEVELOP AND CONSERVE ENERGY, AND MAKE DELIVERIES TO SHAREHOLDERS MORE RELIABLE AND EFFICIENT  THIS WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT STARTING AUGUST 15, 2022, WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF MARCH 15, 2023 INTENDED BENEFICIARIES THE WATER CONSERVATION FIELD SERVICES PROGRAM PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROJECTS THAT RESULT IN WATER MANAGEMENT PLANNING  THESE PLANNING PROJECTS SUPPORT PLANNING FOR WATER MANAGERS TO PLAN, PRIORITIZE, AND DESIGN PROJECTS THAT CONSERVE AND USE WATER MORE EFFICIENTLY  MITIGATE CONFLICT RISK IN AREAS AT A HIGH RISK OF FUTURE WATER CONFLICT  AND ACCOMPLISH OTHER BENEFITS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO SUSTAINABILITY IN THE WESTERN UNITED STATES SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   N A

AWARD PURPOSE  UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL TAKE A COMPREHENSIVE LOOK AT THE CURRENT AND FUTURE OPERATION OF THE DISTRICT S MAIN CANAL  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  TASKS WILL INCLUDE ASSESSING THE CANAL, COMPILING THE INFORMATION, REVIEWING OPPORTUNITIES AND POSSIBILITIES FOR OPERATION FOR LOWER FLOWS AND RELATED ISSUES, SETTING PRIORITIES, PREPARING INFORMATION AND REPORTS, REVIEWING WITH BOARD MEMBERS AND THE PUBLIC EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  THIS WATER CONSERVATION FIELD SERVICES PROGRAM PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROJECTS THAT RESULT IN WATER MANAGEMENT PLANNING  THESE PLANNING PROJECTS SUPPORT PLANNING FOR WATER MANAGERS TO PLAN, PRIORITIZE, AND DESIGN PROJECTS THAT CONSERVE AND USE WATER MORE EFFICIENTLY  MITIGATE CONFLICT RISK IN AREAS AT A HIGH RISK OF FUTURE WATER CONFLICT  AND ACCOMPLISH OTHER BENEFITS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO SUSTAINABILITY IN THE WESTERN UNITED STATES INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  SAME AS ABOVE  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   CONTRACTOR FOR ENGINEERING CONSULTANT SERVICES TO ASSIST WITH PROJECT ACTIVITIES

THE CENTRAL ARIZONA IRRIGATION AND DRAINAGE DISTRICT (CAIDD) IS A POLITICAL SUBDIVISION AND MUNICIPAL CORPORATION OF THE STATE OF ARIZONA. CAIDD WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1964 TO SUPPLY IRRIGATION WATER FOR AGRICULTURAL USE WITHIN PINAL COUNTY, ARIZONA FOR APPROXIMATELY 87,600 ACRES AS WELL AS FOR RESIDENTIAL AND COMMERCIAL USE. THE OVERALL SYSTEM CONSISTS OF 41 MILES OF OPEN CHANNEL MAIN STEM CANALS, 139.25 MILES OF OPEN CHANNEL LATERALS AND 34.75 MILES OF PIPELINES. SINCE 1990, CAIDD HAS RELIED ON TWO PRIMARY SOURCES OF WATER: CENTRAL ARIZONA PROJECT (CAP) AND PREVIOUSLY, THEIR GROUNDWATER RETENTION SYSTEM CONSISTING OF A NETWORK OF 350 WELLS AND CONVEYANCE STRUCTURES.CAIDD IS SLOWLY WORKING TO UPGRADE THEIR IRRIGATION SYSTEM TO IMPROVE MEASUREMENT ACCURACY, CONTROL, AND APPLICATION OF WATER ONTO IRRIGATED LANDS. THE SYSTEM OPERATION REVIEW (SOR) WILL PROVIDE THE MANAGEMENT TOOLS TO HELP IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE THE IMPROVEMENTS THAT ARE NEEDED TO MODERNIZE AND BETTER OPERATE THE COMPLEX NETWORK OF CANALS, LATERALS, PIPELINES, WELLS/PUMPS, AND APPURTENANT FEATURES IN THE MOST EFFICIENT MANNER.CAIDD WILL EVALUATE THEIR ENTIRE DELIVERY SYSTEM RANGING FROM INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS THAT NEED REPAIRS/REPLACEMENTS/ IMPROVEMENTS TO OVERALL MANAGEMENT FOR COORDINATION AND SCHEDULING, FLOW PATHS AND DEMAND/USE. THEY WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE LOCAL FARMERS AND PRODUCERS TO IDENTIFY ON-FARM PROJECTS THAT WILL COMPLEMENT ASSOCIATED IMPROVEMENTS. CAIDD WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL SUPPORT SERVICES TO THE ISOLATED DESERT COMMUNITY, INCLUDING THE TOHONO O'ODHAM INDIAN NATION, SAN LUCY DISTRICT, TOHONO O'ODHAM FARMING AUTHORITY, AND OTHER AGRICULTURAL LANDS

GLOBAL WATER RESOURCES INC   GLOBAL WATER  IS PARTNERING WITH SOURCE GLOBAL, PBS  SOURCE GLOBAL  TO EXPLORE AIR TO WATER GENERATING TECHNOLOGY  SOURCE GLOBAL PRODUCES ADVANCED, INFRASTRUCTURE FREE, HYDROPANEL TECHNOLOGY THAT COMBINES SOLAR PHOTOVOLTAIC CELLS WITH HIGH EFFICIENCY SOLAR THERMAL POWER TO PRODUCE WATER IN A MODIFIED PSYCHROMETRIC CYCLE  I E , CONVERTING AIR TO WATER   GLOBAL WATER IS COMMITTED TO SUSTAINABLE WATER MANAGEMENT, INCLUDING THE EXPLORATION OF ALTERNATIVE WATER RESOURCES THAT COULD REDUCE DEMAND ON OUR PRECIOUS AND SCARCE WATER SUPPLIES  THIS DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WILL TEST THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SOURCE GLOBAL TECHNOLOGY IN THE CITY OF MARICOPA, GLOBAL WATER S LARGEST SERVICE AREA  FUNDING FROM THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE PURCHASE, INSTALLATION, AND EVALUATION OF SOURCE GLOBAL PANELS  THESE PANELS WILL BE INSTALLED AT THE COPPER SKY REGIONAL PARK AND WILL BE COUPLED WITH AN EDUCATIONAL DISPLAY THAT EXPLAINS THIS NEW TECHNOLOGY AND PROVIDE A WATER BOTTLE FILLING STATION FOR PEOPLE TO TASTE THE WATER  AFTER A YEAR OF DATA ACQUISITION, GLOBAL WATER WILL EXAMINE THE RESULTS TO EVALUATE WHETHER THIS TECHNOLOGY COULD BECOME A VIABLE WATER RESOURCE ALTERNATIVE FOR CUSTOMERS IN THE FUTURE THE AIR TO WATER GENERATING DEMONSTRATION PROJECT WILL BE LOCATED AT THE COPPER SKY REGIONAL PARK IN THE CITY OF MARICOPA  CITY , JUST SOUTH OF THE SWIMMING POOL  THE CITY IS GLOBAL WATER S LARGEST SERVICE AREA, WITH OVER 22,000 CUSTOMER CONNECTIONS  MARICOPA FALLS WITHIN THEIR SANTA CRUZ WATER SYSTEM  THE CITY IS IN CENTRAL ARIZONA, SOUTH OF PHOENIX AND NORTH OF CASA GRANDE

THE PROPOSED AGREEMENT WILL HELP MAKE MORE EFFICIENT USE OF EXISTING WATER SUPPLIES BY IDENTIFYING AND EVALUATING THE APPLICATION OF NEW ADVANCED COOLING TECHNOLOGIES THAT USE LESS WATER CONSUMPTIVELY.AS SEVERE AND SUSTAINED DROUGHT CONDITIONS IN THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN CONTINUE TO THREATEN WATER SUPPLIES AND DELIVERY SYSTEMS, WATER CONSERVATION IS A CRITICAL TOOL USED TO ENSURE A SAFE AND RELIABLE DRINKING WATER SUPPLY FOR SOUTHERN NEVADA. THE PROPOSED PROJECT BUILDS ON THE SOUTHERN NEVADA WATER AUTHORITY'S (SNWA) CONSERVATION EFFORTS BY IDENTIFYING AND EVALUATING COOLING SYSTEM TECHNOLOGIES THAT USE LESS WATER CONSUMPTIVELY. SNWA WILL PARTNER WITH WATERSTART, WHICH OPERATES A PLATFORM TO PROMOTE VIABLE TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS TO WATER UTILITIES AND OTHER WATER SYSTEMS MANAGERS ACROSS THREE CONTINENTS.

THE MARICOPA-STANFIELD IRRIGATION AND DRAINAGE DISTRICT (MSIDD) IS A POLITICAL SUBDIVISION AND MUNICIPAL CORPORATION OF THE STATE OF ARIZONA. MSIDD WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1962 TO SUPPLY IRRIGATION WATER FOR AGRICULTURAL USE WITHIN PINAL COUNTY, ARIZONA FOR APPROXIMATELY 82,000 ACRES. THE OVERALL SYSTEM CONSISTS OF 75 MILES OF OPEN CHANNEL MAIN STEM CANALS, 200 MILES OF OPEN CHANNEL LATERALS AND 20 MILES OF PIPELINES. SINCE 1990, MSIDD HAS RELIED ON TWO PRIMARY SOURCES OF WATER: CENTRAL ARIZONA PROJECT (CAP) AND PREVIOUSLY, THEIR GROUNDWATER RETENTION SYSTEM CONSISTING OF A NETWORK OF 160 WELLS AND APPURTENANT FEATURES.MSIDD IMPLEMENTED A SUPERVISORY CONTROL AND DATA ACQUISITIONS (SCADA) ON TWO OF THEIR MAIN STEM CANALS IN 1992. THE AGING SYSTEM IS BARELY FUNCTIONAL WITH SYSTEM SITES FAILING WHILE PARTS AND EQUIPMENT ARE NO LONGER AVAILABLE. CURRENT SCADA SYSTEMS ARE MUCH MORE ROBUST AND HAVE RELIABLE SENSORS, RADIOS, TELEMETRY, AND IRRIGATION SYSTEM COMPATIBLE SCADA READY SOFTWARE.CONDUCTING THIS SYSTEM OPERATION REVIEW (SOR) WILL ENABLE MSIDD TO DEVELOP A MULTI-PHASED APPROACH TO ADDRESS THE FACTORS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE INEFFICIENCY AND WATER LOSSES PRESENT IN THEIR CURRENT CONVEYANCE SYSTEM. THE AGING INFRASTRUCTURE AND DEFICIENT FLOW MEASUREMENT EQUIPMENT WITH OUTDATED SCADA MANAGEMENT TOOLS NEED TO BE REPLACED. THIS SOR WILL PROVIDE THE GUIDANCE NEEDED TO MODERNIZE AND BETTER OPERATE THEIR COMPLEX NETWORK OF CANALS, LATERALS, PIPELINES, WELL PUMPS AND APPURTENANT FEATURES IN THE MOST EFFICIENT MANNER.MSIDD WILL WORK WITH THEIR STAKEHOLDERS INCLUDING FARMERS AND CUSTOMERS IN THE DISTRICT, THE CENTRAL ARIZONA IRRIGATION AND DRAINAGE DISTRICT, AK-CHIN INDIAN COMMUNITY AND THE U.S. BUREAU OF RECLAMATION, TO DEVELOP A PLAN THAT WILL IDENTIFY AND SCHEDULE CONSTRUCTION/AUTOMATION PRIORITIES.

THE PALOMA IRRIGATION AND DRAINAGE DISTRICT (PIDD) HAS OPERATED FOR OVER 100 YEARS USING PRIMARILY MANUAL CONTROLS TO DELIVER WATER TO THEIR WATER USERS. PIDD OPERATES AND MAINTAINS 99 MILES OF IRRIGATION DITCHES AND CANALS. THE IRRIGATION SYSTEM IS INEFFICIENT AND PRONE TO UNCONTROLLED RELEASES, SPILLS, AND OVERFLOWS, AND REQUIRES CONSTANT OVERWATCH AND MAINTENANCE. THEIR IRRIGATION SYSTEM RELIES ON 84 WELLS (64%) AND SURFACE WATER FROM THE GILA RIVER (25%) TO PROVIDE 185,000 ACRE FEET OF WATER PER YEAR TO 27,000 ACRES.PIDD IS SLOWLY WORKING TO UPGRADE THEIR IRRIGATION SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM OPTIMIZATION REVIEW (SOR, THE "REPORT," OR THE "PROJECT") WILL ENABLE PIDD TO TAKE A BROAD LOOK AT THEIR ENTIRE DELIVERY SYSTEM RANGING FROM INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS THAT NEED REPAIRS, REPLACEMENT, OR IMPROVEMENTS, TO OVERALL MANAGEMENT FOR COORDINATION AND SCHEDULING, FLOW PATHS, AND DEMAND/USE.PIDD WILL INCLUDE "BEST PRACTICES" MODELING TO OPTIMIZE EFFICIENCY, REDUCE WATER LOSSES, AND IMPROVE WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT. PIDD ALSO PLANS TO USE THE SOR TO IDENTIFY COST EFFECTIVE ENHANCEMENT FOR THE DAILY MANAGEMENT OF THEIR COMPLEX WATER DELIVERY NETWORK.PIDD WILL ACCOMPLISH THE GOALS ESTABLISHED FOR THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION'S LOWER COLORADO BASIN REGION'S WATER CONSERVATION FIELD SERVICES PROGRAM BY USING THE SOR TO HELP DEVELOP STRATEGIES AND IMPLEMENT ACTIONS TO INCREASE WATER SYSTEM EFFICIENCY AND SUPPLY RELIABILITY THROUGH RECOMMENDATIONS THAT MAY INCLUDE ELECTRONIC TECHNOLOGIES WITH AUTOMATION AND NETWORKING. PIDD WILL INCORPORATE THESE STRATEGIES IN THE NEXT UPDATE TO THEIR WATER MANAGEMENT PLAN.

THE TASKS TO BE COMPLETED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL ASSESS THE POTENTIAL FOR WATER MANAGEMENT IMPROVEMENTS AND IDENTIFY A PLAN OF ACTION CONTAINING RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTING SPECIFIC IMPROVEMENTS THAT HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO ENHANCE WATER MANAGEMENT.THE LONG BEACH WATER DEPARTMENT CURRENTLY RECEIVES ITS POTABLE WATER SUPPLY FROM TWO SOURCES: IMPORTED WATER THROUGH METROPOLITAN WATER DISTRICT OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA AND FROM GROUNDWATER THROUGH ITS WELLS LOCATED IN THE CENTRAL GROUNDWATER BASIN (THE BASIN). LBWD'S POTABLE WATER SUPPLY PORTFOLIO IS COMPRISED OVER 40% FROM THE COLORADO RIVER (MANAGED BY THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION) VIA THE COLORADO RIVER AQUEDUCT AND SAN FRANCISCO BAY DELTA (THE DELTA) VIA THE STATE WATER PROJECT. THE REMAINING 60% IS PROVIDED BY THE BASIN. TO IMPROVE THE RELIABILITY OF ITS WATER SUPPLIES TO THE RESIDENTS AND BUSINESSES WITHIN THE CITY OF LONG BEACH, THE LONG BEACH WATER DEPARTMENT IS DEVELOPING A WATER SYSTEM OPTIMIZATION AND SUPPLY MANAGEMENT STUDY SYSTEM OPTIMIZATION REVIEW, THE "REPORT" OR THE "PROJECT". THE PROJECT WILL EVALUATE THE WATER SYSTEM AND CURRENT OPERATIONAL PROCEDURES OF LBWD AND WILL MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPROVEMENTS NECESSARY TO ACCOMMODATE A SHIFT IN FUTURE WATER SUPPLIES AND POTENTIAL REDUCTION OF DEPENDENCY ON THE COLORADO RIVER.UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT IS TO PREPARE A REPORT THAT WILL IDENTIFY AND EVALUATE THE POTENTIAL HYDRAULIC AND OPERATIONAL CONSTRAINTS OF THE POTABLE DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM AND TO UTILIZE MORE GROUNDWATER SUPPLIES AS A KEY COMPONENT IN PLANNING THAT WILL ALLOW SHIFTING ITS WATER SUPPLY PORTFOLIO TO MORE LOCAL WATER RESOURCES. THE PROCESS FOR PREPARATION OF THE REPORT WILL REQUIRE A DETAILED ANALYSIS OF THE WATER DELIVERY SYSTEM. THE TASKS FOR PREPARATION OF THE REPORT ARE DESCRIBED BELOW:- DATA COLLECTION AND REVIEW- EVALUATION OF EXISTING AND POTENTIAL WATER SYSTEM CONSTRAINTS- DEVELOPMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF WELL CAPACITY TARGET- ALTERNATIVES ANALYSIS OF GROUNDWATER COLLECTION SYSTEM- WATER SYSTEM OPTIMIZATION AND SUPPLY MANAGEMENT REPORT DEVELOPMENTTHE FINAL REPORT WILL INCORPORATE THE EVALUATIONS FROM PREVIOUS STUDIES, WATER SYSTEM ANALYSIS, PROJECT GOALS, THE GROUNDWATER MANAGEMENT AND ALTERNATIVES DISCUSSION, AND RECOMMENDATIONS INCLUDING A CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECT'S (CIP) PLAN.UPON THE EXECUTION OF THE TASKS STATED ABOVE, THE LONG BEACH WATER DEPARTMENT WILL BE ABLE TO TAKE THE NEXT STEPS IN MODERNIZING THEIR EXISTING WATER DELIVERY INFRASTRUCTURE TO GAIN OPTIMUM EFFICIENCY IN OPERATIONS OF WATER SUPPLIES.

THIS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT (AGREEMENT) IS ENTERED INTO BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, ACTING THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR, BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (RECLAMATION) AND CITY OF RIO RANCHO (RECIPIENT), PURSUANT TO SECTION 9504(A) OF THE SECURE WATER ACT, PUBLIC LAW 111-11 (42 UNITED STATES CODE 10364), AS AMENDED.  THE FOLLOWING SECTION, PROVIDED IN FULL TEXT, AUTHORIZES RECLAMATION TO AWARD THIS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AG CFDA - 15.530 WATER CONSERVATION FIELD SERVICES PROGRAM.

THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IDENTIFY WHICH COMBINATIONS OF PIVOT IRRIGATION AND CROP MANAGEMENT PRACTICES RESULT IN OPTIMIZED USE OF LIMITED WATER SUPPLIES, REDUCED CONSUMPTIVE USE, AND THE BEST YIELD AND PROFIT OUTCOMES FOR PRODUCERS. THIS INFORMATION WILL  BE ESPECIALLY USEFUL IN GUIDING WATER CONSERVATION PLANNING AT THE FARM LEVEL, WHICH WOULD IN TURN HAVE LARGE IMPACTS ON PLANNING EFFORTS AT BASIN AND WATERSHED LEVELS. IT WOULD ALSO HELP IRRIGATORS PREPARE TO EFFECTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN WATER BANKING OR SHARING PROGRAMS.
